sen.j: 西園寺 実永（さいおんじ さねなが、天授 (日本)3年/永和 (日本)3年（1377年）‐永享3年10月9日 (旧暦)（1431年11月13日））は、室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Sanenaga SAIONJI (1377-November 13, 1431) was Kugyo (the top court official) in the Muromachi period.
Sanenaga SAIONJI (1377-November 13, 1431) was Kugyo (top court official) during the Muromachi period.
Sanenaga SAIONJI (1377-November 22, 1431) was Kugyo (top court official) during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 後小松天皇（100代）・称光天皇（101代）の二代にわたり仕え、従一位右大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He served in two generations of the Emperor Gokomatsu (the hundredth) and the Emperor Shoko (the hundred and first), and promoted up to Juichii (Junior First Rank) Udaijin (minister of the right).
He served the two generations of Emperor Gokomatsu (the 100th) and Emperor Shoko (the 101st), and waspromoted to Juichii (Junior 1st Rank) Udaijin (minister of the right).
He served the two generations of Emperor Gokomatsu (the 100th) and Emperor Shoko (the 101st), and was promoted to Juichii (Junior 1st Rank) Udaijin (minister of the right).
sen.cmt: wasとpromotedの間にスペースを入れました。

sen.j: 父は大納言西園寺公永。
sen.e: His father was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kinnaga SAIONJI.
His father was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kinnaga SAIONJI.
His father was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kinnaga SAIONJI.

sen.j: 子に太政大臣西園寺公名がいる。
sen.e: His child was Daijo-daijin (grand minister of state) Kinna SAIONJI.
His child was Daijo-daijin (grand minister of state) Kinna SAIONJI.
His child was Daijo-daijin (grand minister of state) Kinna SAIONJI.
His original name was Sanemura.
His original name was Sanemura.
His original name was Sanemura.

sen.j: 明徳4年（1393年）に参議となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1393, he became Sangi (councilor) and was raised to Kugyo.
In 1393, he became Sangi (councilor) and was raised to Kugyo.
In 1393, he became Sangi (councilor) and was raised to Kugyo.

sen.j: 応永2年（1395年）には中納言となる。
sen.e: In 1395, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
In 1395, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
In 1395, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
In 1399, he became Dainagon.
In 1399, he became Dainagon.
In 1399, he became Dainagon.

sen.j: 応永22年（1415年）には右近衛大将となる。
sen.e: In 1415, he became Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 本来の原文は、「近衛府」となっていましたが、意味不明なためウェブを参照したところ「右近衛大将」となっていたためこちらで訳出しております。
sen.e: In 1415, he became Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1415, he became Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 応永26年（1419年）には内大臣に任命された。
sen.e: In 1419, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister).
In 1419, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister).
In 1419, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the center).
sen.cmt: ministerの後にof the centerを補いました。

sen.j: 翌年、右大臣に転任するも辞職する。
sen.e: Though he transferred to Udaijin (minister of the right) the next year, he resigned.
Though he transferred to Udaijin (minister of the right) the next year, he resigned.
Though he transferred to Udaijin (minister of the right) the next year, he resigned.

sen.j: 応永28年（1421年）に従一位を授与された。
sen.e: In 1421, he was conferred Juichii.
In 1421, he was conferred Juichii.
In 1421, he was conferred Juichii.
